channel.title: Oop
channel.description:
I'm starting a project that I'll work on it only in my free times and when I feel like to; no stress. I really want to work with OOP concepts as much as possible and I had a question:
It's a role-game (a bit like RuneScape). When a player logs in, should I create a new instance of the character and load his information when calling the constructor, or simply load character information and not making a new instance.

item.title: Oop
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“xxxtilllyxxx, post:9, topic:470232”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=587629.msg4169597#msg4169597 date=1354124304]
IT HAS TO DO WITH OOP IF IT HAS TO DO WITH JAVA
[/quote]

That was Uncalled for.[/quote]The more I hear it, the funnier it gets!

Read full topic

item.title: Oop
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Tmesis, post:3, topic:470232”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=587629.msg4169376#msg4169376 date=1354079226]
why would you make a thread titled ‘OOP’ when this has nothing to do with oop…?
[/quote]
I think it has every thing to do with OOP. They want to do things as OO as possible I assume and are asking which route to take. Plus they mention OOP in their post.[/quote]
No, the main topic of help in this has nothing to do with OOP.

But as it’s been stated, it’s self preference.

Read full topic

item.title: Oop
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

ok so yea, you could load the character data in the constructor, or you can do what i have shown in the example and make it it’s own method. one advantage of doing it like so is that you can add each character object that logs in into a database queue to be loaded in a separate thread, or better yet, a login server of some sort.

Read full topic

item.title: Oop
item.dc:creator: @Hash1 Hash1
item.description:
@Hash1 wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:4, topic:470232”]oop does not include doing every bit of work in a class constructor…

with your logic (as well as OP’s logic) this is not oop

[code=java]public class Player {

private final String username;

public Player(String username) {
	this.username = username;
}

public void load(ServerContext ctx) {
	// load em up
}

}[/code]

edit: idk maybe i misunderstood op, idk[/quote]

I use an interface for the methods, which are implemented by the Character class, which is extended by Soldier, Mage, Archer, etc.

Read full topic

public Player(String username) {
	this.username = username;
}

public void load(ServerContext ctx) {
	// load em up
}

}[/code]

item.title: Oop
item.dc:creator: @Tmesis Tmesis
item.description:
@Tmesis wrote:

I would say not create a new instance because you don’t want a new instance of the game every time player logs in? Only player attributes.

imthenull:

why would you make a thread titled ‘OOP’ when this has nothing to do with oop…?

I think it has every thing to do with OOP. They want to do things as OO as possible I assume and are asking which route to take. Plus they mention OOP in their post.

Read full topic

item.title: Oop
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

why would you make a thread titled ‘OOP’ when this has nothing to do with oop…?

And it doesn’t matter how you load the data, it’s your preference

Read full topic
